Replies.Reply: Oh my God! I can't believe my eyes! Look at these women! Will you look at the gorgeous calves on them?! I'm telling you, give me an athlete any day... Oh God!
The blonde over there, she's too gorgeous for words. Just look at those eyes, look at those shoulders and the way she moves.
Hello.   I'm the captain of this plane.   May I ask your name?
Listen, Jane, I've seen many beautiful women in my life but I swear to you, I've never, ever met a woman as exquisite as you are.
Jane, can you feel my heart? It's pounding. This is horrible, I think I'm gonna faint. Listen: I'm madly in love with you, I'm single and here's my phone number.
I'm putting my fate in your hands.
No, I'm not.
Yes, I'm the pilot...
... I'm not even asking for your phone number...
Yeah, the copilot -- he's up front...
I'm leaving it all up to you, Jane, but if you do give me your phone number, then Jane, then...
I got her phone number!   She gave me her phone number!
It's wonderful -- Life is wonderful!

This is your captain speaking. In honor of your victory, in honor of your beauty, and in honor of Jane, the most beautiful gymnast I have ever met. I'm going to give you a little demonstration of aviation gymnastics -- reserved only for the most important guest, hip, hip...
God, what a woman!
Wanna share a cab?

She's so beautiful! I've never been so in love before. Can you believe she gave me her phone number... Oh, Christ -- where is it?... Oh, no, don't tell me I lost it... It's a matter of life and death... Oh here it is --
Yeah, sure... Hey, look, will you -- look at that sparkling beauty.
She'll never make it with all that luggage she's got. I gotta give her a hand. Look at the colors in her hair! Christ, I've never seen a woman like her before...
Sure you can, no problem...
Come over to my place tonight.
As exquisite as you are...
This is no line and I'm not trying to get you into bed. This is something completely different.
I'm having a hard time.    I'm working on two at once.
The brunette in the armchair in the living room -- her name's Rosalie...
Clementine -- she's waiting for me in the den.
Oh, hi, Paul, yeah sure...
... Please darling, don't move...
You're a lifesaver, Paul. I thought I'd never get away.
Clementine.
Yeah... What kind of favor?
Yeah, sure, of course.
No, wait, I'm leaving for South America tomorrow. I'll be gone for three weeks.
But it's okay. Peter and Michael will be here. They'll take care of it.
Absolutely.   Don't worry about a thing.
Delivered Sunday picked up Thursday. Got it. No problem.
Sure. You got it.    I'll see you later...
Okay, sure, not to anyone at all... Look, I'm sorry Paul, but I gotta get back to Rosalie. Now go have a good time. I'll take care of everything.
Don't mention it.
Uh-oh.   Too late.
Oh my darling, oh my darling, oh my darling Clementine.
Nice work if you can get it, and you can get it if you try... Any scotch left?
Sorry I can't give you guys a hand, but I've got something cooking.
I am, the night's still young!...
Maxine.    Beautiful, enchanting Maxine.
Hey, Michael -- how'd it go with Rosalie?
Your old friend Sophia appeared and dragged you into a thrilling conversation about modern art and in the meantime Rosalie took off with someone else.
I dunno -- lucky guess...
Don't worry, I'll leave you her phone number on the hall table.
Damn! I forgot to tell them about the package!
I gotta make a quick phone call.
Oh, c'mon, I've really got to make a phone call! What do you think I'm going to do, pick up one of the New Jersey delegates to the I.B.M. convention?
Yoo-hoo, guys! I'm home! I've got presents for you... so where's that wonderful fantastic babe...
... What the hell happened here?
Peter!    Michael! Are you here?
Oh, my God! My beautiful room!
What the hell is going on around here? What happened to this place?
Oh, I get it. The    'silent' treatment!
I paid to have this place decorated, too, you know. I'm not going to let you get away with this.
It's too late to try and talk me out of it. I'm history. I'm gone.
I'm giving you one more chance to...
And that's another thing! I will not have a baby in this house!
Hey, will you please stop talking like Mr. Rogers? It's getting on my nerves.
What?
What are you guys talking about?
What??
It's ridiculous. I look ridiculous.
He should try South America.
Paul, hi, it's Jack! Hey, listen, I brought you back a little present from South America. Can I see you right away so I can give it to you?
That was for your 'little' package, and consider yourself lucky I didn't turn you in to the cops!
Crawl.
Listen, Sylvia, you've got to come back. I travel, I can't take care of her... Yeah, but you're her mother... I'm her father -- what makes you so sure I'm the father!?
Shit! That bitch hung up on me!
Replies.Didascalie: (CONT'D) (he slams the receiver down like he was hammering a nail)

Replies.Reply: Who was that?
What? Jesus Christ, Michael, why didn't you let me talk to her!?
You jerk! You should've said she was terrible, sick as hell!
Mom? Hi, how are you?... Yes, I'm fine. Yes, I'm eating well. Mom, how would you feel if I told you you were a grandma?...
... Yeah... A little girl, Mary...
... I'd love you to see her. In fact, I was gonna bring her down tomorrow... today?... Great, I think there's a flight in three hours. I'll be at your place by two. See you real soon!
Okay...
I'll tell her.
Right.     Full of shit.
Bottle of water, white as snow...
Really, by hand?
Rinse three times.
My mother lives alone.
Okay.
I gotta get going, I'll miss my plane...

Replies.Reply: Hey, Mom!
But, Mom, I missed the plane.
Where are you going?
But why didn't you say so on the phone?
'Bye!
Yeah... she's starving. I gotta heat this bottle up right away.
Goddamn cruises...
Sure she did, but she was just leaving for some stupid cruise around the world. The entire fucking world! With some bimbo boyfriend of her's... and a bunch of retired bozos.
What?
Oh, yes, I was expecting you.
She wants to see Mary.
Well, she wants to see her anyway!
Nothing, nothing.
Yeah, but the nanny, Mrs. Bretsaws, she wants to see her.
Yeah, but she wants to see her.
No, no, Peter, please, really, don't go, don't bother, I'll go explain it to her myself...
Wanna bet she's out of here in ten minutes slamming the door behind her?
What did I tell you? Ten minutes to the second!

Okay, listen, you guys... I've tried everything and nothing's working: my mother's off on a cruise; Mrs. Razzolini won't speak to us ever since the whole business with the cops -- we don't want to involve any of our girlfriends; Sylvia's taking it easy in Europe and there's no way she's gonna come back now that Michael went and told her everything's just fine and dandy.
What do you mean, organized?
What? Never! I'd rather be a subway conductor.
No!   Never.
Well, needless to say I refuse, too!
Hey, horny yourself! I don't give a shit. I don't need you guys. I'll find some other way to do it. And I won't take the New York-Washington shuttle!
Oh, hi... Nah, nothing's wrong.
I was asking to do the New York-
As a matter of fact, he said 'yes.' Paul backs up against the wall, protecting his face with his arms. Jack leaves, disgusted. Paul watches him go, totally confused.
Okay, I'm off. She's well fed and she's sleeping now.
Shit, she's crying.      I'll go pick her up...
No, she needs to burp -- I've gotta rock her for a little...
Thanks for the advice -- now why don't you just shove it? I know you let her scream for hours but I can't.
You'd resort to any theory to not take care of her. Just because you've read some books...
It's not your shift, anyway.
Shit, she's crying...
Nothing, nothing. I'll be right back.
It' beddy-bye time now, honey, beddy-bye, don't cry, sweetheart...
Yeah, every time I try to put her back to bed...
What should I do?
Watch your mouth, will you? I'm in love with that young lady.
Listen, at night I'm in charge.
Oh, Michael, go to hell! I'm sick and tired of your little 'Father Knows Best' number!
I didn't ask you to get up, I know what I have to do.
If I can't bring a girl back here anymore, just say so. And I'm gone.
And again, and again, and again...
No! Wait, please don't go... it's all over now, I'm coming back to bed...
I tried, but she doesn't want anything --
Well, actually... uh, lately I've been to Washington a lot... and uh... I'll be right back.
I'm warning you, she'll scream...
That's not fair -- let's take Mary out there...
Ladies and gentlemen, I would like you to meet my daughter, Mary.
Don't cry, Mary, don't cry...
A few months...
It's her teeth...
Stop it, Peter. Give her to me, I'll put her to bed...
Well, she's asleep at last! We sang in har... Hey, where is everybody?
You mean they're all gone?
Peter! Peter, goddamit, get out here!
They're all gone!
It's because of the kid.     They can't stand kids.
And did    you hear Natalie: 'She's throwing    a temper tantrum, just put her    to bed.' What a pain-in-
I scared    everyone aw... Just cut the    crap, will you? My whole life is    diapers, shuttles and bottles.     I do the graveyard shift, I'm the    one who never gets any sleep.     I...
She's been gone for six months and four days.
Don't worry, she's gonna get it but good!
Let's see, the five bottles, the little bottles for water, the strainer for her cereal...
... Do you have a blender?
For bananas and carrots and stuff.
Here, could you give these to Michael so he can pack them with the clothes?
You really screwed us over but good -- you know that...
Really. Our lives have been out of control for the past six months.
Don't cry, c'mon... you're taking her back now, it's great...
D'you have enough money?     Can you manage all right?
Do you have a boyfriend?
Okay, then... well, 'bye...
Well, that's that!
She'll figure it out by herself...
Now it's back to the good life for us!
Forget about the New York-Washington shuttle! I'm off to Caracas!
Whadda you mean, what's the matter with me?
Me?   No.   I'm fine.
Sure I did, why?
So it's the Rockettes, so what?
Whaddaya mean, sitting there?
Hi?
Wait... uh, no...
Oh, yeah, the park... the diaper and all...
Have you noticed? I'm pregnant.
So, shall we go for a walk?
Wouldn't you like to be pregnant?
You see, if I was God, and I could create the world all over again, here's what I would do: I would create Adam from Eve's rib, not the other way around.
At least that way things would have been clearer to begin with, y'see. They wouldn't have made us believe that somebody could come out of our rib, y'know?
And you know what, it's not even like they wanted us to believe it -- it might have been us who wanted to believe it... But let's face it, nobody comes out of our rib...
Still, that's hard to take, goddam it!
The dope?   It was in the diaper, why?
But wait -- the baby's gone...
Replies.Didascalie: (reaching out toward him with the rabbit)

Replies.Reply: Tomorrow, San Francisco!
I'll be back the day after tomorrow.
Whaddya mean, now?
Before what?
It doesn't knock me out at all...
No, I'm going to the movies tonight with, uh... damn, I can't remember her name...

Hi.   Is Sylvia in?
Oh.
Sure... Why not?
Sylvia doing okay?
Oh, I see...
Listen, on second thought, I don't think I'll wait for her.
Shouldn't the baby be in bed by now?
Don't you have any tights to put on her legs?
No.
No, I'm not going anywhere anymore, I've had it with traveling. I quit.
Don't you call anybody.
I'll be a dishwasher, I'll live in a flophouse.
He's been here all day.
He's in his room.
Yeah...
Yeah...
Yeah, of course, 'cause after the 5:30 bottle it starts all over again around nine...
And then that's it -- you get only an hour of sleep.
Plus they don't put the kids to bed, they let them lie around half-naked...
I could have strangled that guy...
Of course. Leave her with us.
I'll go heat up some water right away. Would you like a cup of coffee?
She'll need two or three months to recover, at least... Maybe more!
Then we could have four shifts instead of three!
Oh yeah? Which one?
Yeah... Are you Jim?
What about the stuff?
Whadda ya mean us?   You mean me?
But I won't be home, I'll be in the air for two weeks.
Got it.
Yeah... I mean, it's like...
Jack, listen, can I...
But I gotta explain to you about...
Hi Peter, I'm looking for Jack, have you seen him?
Wait -- What about Jack?
Jack, can I talk to you for a second?
Who?   Rosalie?
Oh yeah, for sure, I dunno.
Listen, I've got a little problem.
Will you be sure to tell them about it?
It'll be delivered Sunday and picked up next Thursday, okay?
This is a very delicate matter, Jack. It's very important they don't tell anybody about this package. It could be very... uh, embarrassing for me, you know what I'm saying?
Not to anyone at all.    Tell them that, okay?
Bye and thanks a lot.
Hey, come back! -- how'm I gonna get out of here?
Hi, Jack, something wrong?
What were you doing in the boss's office?
Oh, and he said 'no,' huh?
Sure, my name is Jane.    Why?
Are you Paul?
But you're the pilot, aren't you?
Isn't there a pilot whose name is Paul?
Are you Paul?
Yeah.
Here's your cash.
I mean shut up and listen. Two guys will be waiting for you in a black T-Bird, expecting the dope. Just ignore them. It'll be delivered to you on Sunday and picked up the following Thursday, okay?
That's your problem. Make arrangements, a deal's a deal.
That's some magnificent view, isn't it?
They're slowing down.    Take a picture.
Terrific! I bet these morons screw up everything.
Inspector Graton, Narcotics. It just so happens I was tailing those two guys and now because of you clowns I lost them, probably forever. Thanks a lot!

... My snitch told me the gang hasn't gotten the dope back yet, but they will soon. They made contact with the two guys tonight ... No, no, they don't know I'm tailing them. These jerks are going to fall right into my hands...
Okay, he's coming out alone.
Inspector Graton, Narcotics. Do you admit you gave these men this package?
Officer, will you please open this package in front of these witnesses?
Oh, it's you guys!
You guys must think you're pretty smart, don't ya?
Holy shit! The diaper!
The goddam diaper! What a jerk, what a goddam schmuck I am!
I'm sure the dope was in the diaper. Can I go on tailing them?
I'm sure the dope was in the diaper.
I'm sure the dope was in the diaper.
I'm sure the d...
Hi...
Don't you recognize me?
I'm the one who was tailing you...

That's it, the diaper... But don't worry. This isn't an investigation, I left the force four months ago, and anyway, they've arrested the whole gang since then... I just wanted to ask you something...
Oh yeah, I see...
There's something I have to know...
What? Oh sure... maybe... no...
Really?
That's an interesting idea...
That's for sure...
It's driving me crazy! This thing keeps going around and around in my head...
Was the dope in the diaper, yes or no?
Was it in the diaper, or not?
Oh, thanks a lot. I feel so much better now. Here, this is a rabbit for your baby.
Thanks again, 'bye, I'm so happy.
Are you saying that's art, are you really saying that's art?
Are you saying that's not art? Are you really saying that's not art?
Can you drop me off near Soho by any chance?
Thanks!
'Bye... Say goodbye to them for me...
It goes back to prehistoric man.
Oh yeah, who?
Wait one second for me, I'll be right back.
All's fair, old buddy...
So you struck out again with Natalie, huh? That Carl is a real smooth operator.
Well, I didn't do so well either -- I blew it with Rosalie. I don't even know how...
How could you know that?
That's not true. It's just that Sophia drives me crazy. She knows all the right buttons to push to make me mad.
Terrific... time.
Replies.Didascalie: (still in the living room, shouting to Peter)

Replies.Reply: No, he's cuddling up with a blonde named Clementine...
No, it is Clementine, the one with the tits this big...
Yeah, but he was with Christie at the beginning of the evening --
So, who is it anyway -- Christie or Clementine?
Well, things were going great until...
How did you know?
Well, I don't give a damn anyway, I have 24 drawings to hand in to my editor three days from now and I gotta work all night anyway...
What time is it?
A.M. or P.M.?
Up 'n' at 'em yourself, asshole -- I just went to bed.
Nah, I didn't get anywhere.
Six, six!
What?
What is it?
It's a basket with a baby in it.
What are we going to do with it?
But it says she went to Europe.
Whose phone number?
Why the hell would I have her number? I've never even heard of this chick!
No way. If I had to keep track of all Jack's girlfriends, I'd have to be a full-time secretary.
Hey, look, she's waking up...
Maybe she's hungry?
Feed her, I guess...
Soft stuff... I guess.
Really?   Jack said that?
Oh, so he told you about this?
Boy, he's got a helluva nerve!
Let's call Jack's mother!
Well, just to ask her advice...
But this is an emergency!
Maybe I should call my mother...
Where are you going?!
What am I supposed to do while you're gone?
Whaddya mean, pick her up? I've never held a baby -- I'll drop her!
Okay, okay, don't cry like that...
Rock-a-bye baby on the tree top...
Stop crying now; c'mon, stop...
Mary had a little lamb, little lamb, little lamb, if that jerk isn't back in three seconds I swear I'll throw her down the garbage chute... Mary had a little lamb, little lamb...
Well, it's about goddamn time!
Where the hell have you been?
Oh -- Hi, Mrs. Razzolini!
No, it's not me, I mean she's not mine...
No, no, it's Jack's, I mean it's not Jack's, it's... someone loaned it to us, I mean someone...
Mary.
Yeah, well, I have to put her to bed now.
She's... she's not here.   She'll be back soon.
Well, like, y'see... she doesn't like to be held by strangers...
Oh no, don't worry, I'm used to it.
Well, so long, Mrs. Razzolini.
What a leech! And that other idiot isn't back yet!
So you love to be held by strangers, do you?
What the hell were you doing?
Well, what the hell took   you so long? What'd you do, go    out for breakfast or something?    I didn't even have time for a cup   of coffee, for chrissakes.
Okay, well, here -- take the kid, I've got work to do.
'Cause, it's your problem.    You found this kid.
Jesus, there she goes again!      We gotta feed her something.
Why?
Do you look on top or bottom?
Try feeling with your finger.
She's soaking wet -- did you buy any diapers?
Figures. I'll take care of this, it'll save time.
Excuse me, miss, could you tell me which diapers are the most absorbent?
Yeah, but which are better:    20-35 pounds or 12-24 pounds?
Oh right, how much she weighs...
I have no idea what you're talking about! He's no friend of mine.
I can't hold her. This kid's out of control here!
Then get the cotton yourself if you don't want me to let go of her!
But the couch'll get dirty!
How 'bout after-shave?
How am I supposed to know...?
I don't think they're too big --
My arms are getting tired.
It's not working... What about laying her down?
Well, whaddya expect, if you pull on it like an ape, it's gonna rip!
Or maybe she's hungry again.
Make it snappy, will ya, she's famished.
Oh no you're not, you're not gonna leave me alone with her.
You rotten bastard -- do you see me going out on any dates?
So what! If you leave me alone with this kid, I swear I'll pack up and be outta here by morning.
On second thought, Mr. Oxman...
He didn't say what time?
Terrific! -- We could rot here till eight o'clock tonight.
Jack really could have called. He has to have gotten our message by now.
Damn right!
It's almost time for her bottle, you know.
Yes, he does.
She could have at least given us a phone number or the name of someone to contact...
I don't get it. Didn't they tell you we were gonna be here today?
Sure they told us! So what?
About an hour after her bottle, she starts yawning. Put her to bed right away or it's pure hell for the next three hours, at least that's what we've noticed.
You take it all, man!    It's a package deal!
How do I know? You take it where they told you to take it.
Yeah, whatever you want to call it.
You bet that's the plan! We're not keeping her one more second.
You said it! Now maybe I can get some work done.
Well, a package, I guess.
Yeah, why?
Will you quit shouting!
I don't know... Oh yeah, Sunday --
What's the matter?
Hey, asshole yourself!... Oh shit!
Hey, what's happening? What were those cops doing...
Yeah?   What?
Tell me what...
But did the cops see the dope?
Shit!
Don't worry.
Oh, by the way, I put some water up to boil for her bottle.
Hello, Officers... What's going on?
Did you give her the 5:30 bottle?
Did you change her?
Okay, I'll do it.
Okey-dokey, honeybunch, it's time to go beddy-bye now... We're gonna take a nice long nappy-wappy...
So! Can I get you something to drink?
Yeah, Peter and I just love kids!
Come back anytime, gentlemen.
It's cool, don't worry, I got it stashed.
This way it's close at hand!
Relax, will you.
I diapered the dope on her right in front of the cop and he never noticed a thing!
Wait a minute. You're not gonna stick me with this kid! Tell them you need a maternity leave, tell them anything, but we've got to go 50-50 on this!
Yeah, but don't worry about it, I'll be back before it's time for her next bottle. She's asleep now.
Well, call him back. Tell him you'll come later.
You're crazy. Oxman is leaving in an hour. If I don't meet him before then, I blow my 15,000 dollar contract.
Look, maybe we could pawn her off on Mrs. Razzolini, just for a couple of hours -- she's crazy about her!
Wait -- I hear someone... I'll go see...
Just as I thought -- the goddamn cops are grilling Mrs. Razzolini.
Listen, she's just had her bottle.
Morning, officers. Can I help you?
Search warrant.
Replies.Didascalie: (holding out a piece of paper to him)

Replies.Reply: I believe you,  officer. Go ahead, we have nothing  to hide. Hello, Mrs. Razzolini!

Replies.Reply: You'll have to excuse the mess...
Oh, don't mention it! It was a pleasure having you here! I hope you'll find what you're looking for very soon!
So do we.
Did you hear that? He said there'd been a mistake and they weren't going to bother us anymore.
You think so?    Really?
But he said the investigation was closed.
There's one guy for sure! A redhead, kind of young, disguised sort of like a college student.
I have the feeling they'll come to us.
What do you guys want?
And we want to give it to you.
Hello? Who? Goddamn it, where are you?...
... It's Jack. He just landed in Newark. He came back early.
Make it quick, the punks may be trying to call...
Hello? Listen, tomorrow, Central Park at the fountain near the merry-go-round, five o'clock. Be there, but...
... That was it.
You think the cops have our phone bugged?
All right, Jack. Why don't we start at the very beginning. The very day you left for your vacation...
Yeah, we take goddam care of it.
Peter couldn't leave. Jerry almost jumped out the window. It's lucky they even made it to the finals!
And diapers. Have you ever tried to do diapers?
And the day they wrecked the apartment, Peter came home and couldn't find Mary. I've never seen him in tears like that bef...
And it just so happens, we've got a lot better things to do with our lives than wipe a baby's ass, even if she's yours!
What's going on?
Sure. I gave it to them, just a moment ago.
Is it against the law to give a box of candy to my friends?
I think that guy needs a vacation.
Why don't you call her back?
Hello?... No, it's Michael... How are you?... Oh, she's doing just fine, she's in great shape. We're taking very good care of her, you have nothing to worry about.
Sylvia -- She wanted to know how Mary was doing.
She would have just hung up on you again. The important thing is she knows Mary's fine.
What's with him? The kid's doing really great!
You'll have four already made, this'll hold till Miami.
Tell her to make sure Mary gets plenty of sleep.
If her ass gets red, tell her not to listen to any pediatricians --
Then she should give her a bottle of water instead of the regular bottle. Works like a charm: Her ass will be white as snow in three hours.
Peter says her clothes should be washed by hand...
And only in soap flakes without any artificial color or scent.
To put her to sleep we sing in harmony -- it always works.
Solo works just as well.
Now, as for the nipples, you've got to be very, very, very careful.

As soon as the hole gets too big she's gotta throw them out -- This is extra, extra, extra-specially important -- 'cause if the hole's too big, the milk comes out too fast and it's bad for her digest...
I am!
On his way to Miami.
No, he took Mary to his mother's, she couldn't wait to see her.
Don't worry, I told him everything he had to know, and I made her four bott...

Are you pissed off 'cause she's gone?
I made her four bott...
Four bottles for the goddam trip.
Must be some nanny he found through an agency.
She's asleep.

Come on, stop arguing, you two!
That way, you can do the 6-10 A.M.
Well... I thought you might do it...
Listen to me, you selfish bastards!
Come on, guys, cool it! It's my shift now.
I'll rock her for a few minutes...
... and then I'll put her right to bed. So off to work, both of you.
Coochie, coochie, coo... woo, woo, woo... bippity, boppity boo...
Yeah, okay.
Yeah...
Yeah, okay.
Maybe she's thirsty?
I've bought some stuff for her gums.
Will you quit fighting all the time? She just fell asleep, for Chrissake.
Okay, that's it. Into the kitchen.
I've had it with you assholes! I won't be the buffer between you two anymore...
I'm not a punching bag!   You assholes!
One thing I know: I can't goddamn wait till Sylvia gets back!
Did you give her something to drink?
Well, it's... art. I'll be right back.
Oh shit -- the guests...
And the hell with it.
Don't sit down -- it'll get worse.
No, it's only because she's teething, she's usually very sweet...
Well... umm... How 'bout if I get the cake now, okay?
Ta-da! Will you look at this?
Hey, where is everybody?
Oh, never mind, don't worry...
Gone. Can you make a little room for me on the table to put the...
Yeah, all of 'em, hey, can you make a little room for me to...
Hey, could you make a little room for me on the table so I can...
Oh, fuck it -- I'm sitting down.
And what about me? I'm a prisoner in this house all day long, forget about chasing ass, I haven't gotten laid in six months. When the hell is your friggin' Sylvia gonna come back?
You better give your goddam Sylvia hell for this!

See, my five-month-old grandson weighs more than my neighbor's grandson and he's nine months old.
My grandson, y'know, he has so much hair you can make a ponytail with it! And I know some kids who are totally bald at a year-
Depends how much your baby weighs.
You wouldn't happen to have a friend who came in here a little while ago, would you?
Don't forget -- if the baby's less than three months old, you have to be sure to sterilize the bottles.
This package came for you...
Oh, so it's Peter's?
And what's the little girl's name?
Ooh, what a pwetty wittle name, Mary! I didn't know you had a baby...
You have to put her to bed?    Where's Mary's mommy?
Oh here, this just came for you.
She loves to be held by strangers!
'Bye, Mary, I'll come back to visit.
Yes, I brought a package up to them... I think it was last Sunday...
I'll look in the basket, if you don't mind...
Thank you very much, sorry about this...
Hi! Doin' a little shopping, huh?
We want the dope. Tomorrow.
That's your problem, man. Figure out a way to shake 'em. Either we safely get the dope tomorrow, or you, your friend and the kid'll get this.
We'll call you tonight.
Replies.Didascalie: (he quickly stabs the grocery bags three times)

Replies.Reply: Let's face it... Graton... You've got shit for brains.
Forget it. I have solid information your three suspects never had anything to do with the dealers or the dope.
Did you hear me, Graton?   Case closed.
Hey, he finally made it!
Do you have any idea what time it is? It's four. You said two.
Yeah, but now I have to go.
On a cruise around the world.
Because you never would've come.
Bye-bye, sweetie love... I'll bring you back presents from all over the world.
Four o'clock.
What?
This guy's totally whacko.
Hey, choir boys, you gonna keep it up all night?
Oh my God! There's a baby in there! I'm sorry...
Sorry to disturb you guys, but I'm splitting. I didn't come here to be a bedwarmer. 'Bye.
Oh, cut it out! No more for me!
I do so want some, but if I have anymore I'll pass out!
I love three-tiered cakes!
Yoo-hoo! What are you guys doing in there? It's fucking boring without you...
And do you have kids, too?
I said... and do you have kids, too?
Gosh, my ears are ringing, I can't hear anybody.
I wanna go home...
Jack, tell me about those exotic places, what is Caracas like?
You'd never think something so small could make a noise so big.
I must say, a crying kid is kind of hard to take...
Oh, God, no! Hold it back!
Okay, we're going...
Sorry... say goodbye to Jack for us...
Oh, it's a baby!
Where the hell did that come from? Wow! Is it a boy or a girl? Who does it belong to?
You're kidding! Congratulations!
Need some help?
Who won?
Great!     Who's Peter?
Oh, she's been great!
Hey, what's the matter with you?
Are you sick?
C'mon, Jack! Didn't you see who we've got on board today?
Well... look...
And you're just sitting there like that?
Okay, forget it.
No, she'll be back in a couple of hours -- around midnight, she said...
Wanna come in and wait for her?
I don't know -- I'm a med student.
Sure, no problem.
Yeah... I don't know... When I put her to bed she cries so I just let her stay up...
Tights?... Well, it's pretty hot in here anyway...
